snippet: After the latest defeat for the German chancellor’s center-right party, she tried to convince voters that she was not out of touch with their anger over an influx of migrants....
abstract: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany faces ramifications of 2015 decision allowing hundreds of thousands of displaced migrants to enter country after her party suffers second stinging loss in regional elections; in attempt to shore up voter support she acknowledges widespread anxiety in country and looks toward improving economic and social conditions.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MELISSA EDDY

lead_paragraph: After the latest defeat for the German chancellor’s center-right party, she tried to convince voters that she was not out of touch with their anger over an influx of migrants.

headline.main: Angela Merkel Accepts Responsibility for Party’s Losses in Berlin Election
headline.print_headline: Merkel Accepts Blame for Her Party’s Losses

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
